3.text: No dialogue for this special dungeon.

5.name: Narration
5.text:
They shook their massive bodies and
indiscriminately pounded the houses. Their bodies,
exceeding three meters in height, did not exude
any intelligence or dignity, simply swinging their
club-like logs in frustration.

6.name: Narration
6.text:
With a swing of their logs, houses were blown
away, stone walls were crushed, and the pitiful
goblins caught in between instantly turned into
lumps of flesh.

7.name: Narration
7.text:
And then, the giants, in a fit of rage, recognized
Sol and the others. They drooled, envisioning only
the act of greedily devouring fine flesh, and
fiercely attacked...!

9.name: Narration
9.text:
Their massive legs were shattered, their proud
clubs snapped in half, and with blood gushing from
their noses, the ogres were made to realize just
who they had picked a fight with.

10.name: Narration
10.text:
The giant, crawling on the ground with a vulgar
smile, begs for forgiveness. However, the
adventurers are not so naive as to truly forgive
them.

11.name: Narration
11.text:
A thick arrow pierced the center of the ugly face,
between its eyes. The arrow released from the
hunter's longbow did not miss its mark, destroying
the ogre's brainstem.

13.name: Narration
13.text:
Before their eyes stood a monstrously grotesque
creature. Merely looking at it would steal one's
sanity, suck on human brains, and feed on memories
and emotions... It was a being that could never
coexist with the living.

14.name: Narration
14.text:
The adventurers, guided by her, shake off their
fear and muster their courage to grasp their
swords again. We must defeat this creature, or we
will have no future...!

16.name: Narration
16.text:
A brazen staff sweeps overhead. The warrior,
narrowly avoiding it, thrusts her longsword with a
flash of determination. The sword, piercing the
base of the grotesque body, delivers a decisive
and fatal blow. However, the monster musters its
final ounce of strength.

17.name: Narration
17.text:
Just as the evil tentacles were about to attack
the warrior... the monster's body was engulfed in
flames. It screamed, scattered a savory scent, and
writhed in agony. Confirming that its wicked life
had come to an end, the warrior gave a thumbs-up
with a beaming smile to the golden dragon's child
who had saved her at the last moment.
